answers.answer: I'm sorry that you have to go through this. It is very hard to make such kind decision. Have you had ca125 done?  Is it possible  to lose some weight before surgery? I don't have such experience, cann't help that much. Just want to make sure at least u have some answers. Hope someone can help you more.Peacejun

I am not of your weight, but I did look up surgery risk for obese. It said the main risk is heart. Do you already have any heart conditions you are taking medication for? I would consult a cardiologist if so before the surgery. The other main risk would be nerve damage ( I don,t know about that, it wasn.t the main risk. I had two surgeries in two years. It probably is going to depend on your job, sitting or standing,etc. I feel it will take at least six weeks, the first 2 or 3 are the worst. Who is doing the surgery? A gyn or general surgeon? You might post dr. goodman on the dr forum. It is on the right hand side of the forum page instead of the left.  Donna

Thank you for comments.  I have had a ca125 done, waiting for that result too.  I will talk to a cardiologist before having the surgery.  (I didn't think of that).  I already have neuropathy from the diabetes, so nerve damage is a possibility I guess.  I would like to try and lose weight before the surgery, but do I risk waiting for the surgery?  One of the doctors says this type of mass grows very quickly.  What if it ruptures before I lose enough weight?  I've been battling the weight issue all my adult life.  Anyway, thank you both for your messages, it does just feel better having someone like-minded to consult with!

question: I had CT Scan & Transvag ultasound revealing a 8.5 x 6.5 dermoid cyst.  I am obese (350 pounds).  The doctor said it was a risky surgery because of my weight and the size of the mass.  They recommended a hysterectomy, not just removal of the mass.  I am 46 and do not intend to have more children.Has anyone had a similar experience?  I'm concerned about the pain returning (it sent me to the ER two nights ago and that was when I had all the tests).  I'm also concerned about being out of work for 6-8 weeks for recovery.What is the recovery like for an open surgery of this nature in an obese woman?ThanksMorrowville
title: Dermoid Cyst of the Ovary on Obese Woman
